prompt: Search prior insurance outbound calls for the one where the agent reviewed Medicare Advantage plan options with the client.
Locate the outbound call where the representative confirmed the customer's current Medicare plan and monthly premium.
Find the earlier insurance outbound conversation where the agent explained extra benefits like dental, vision, and hearing coverage.
Retrieve the transcript of the outbound call where the caller discussed lowering prescription drug costs under a Medicare plan.
Search past insurance outbound calls for the one where the agent verified the client's date of birth and address before discussing coverage.
Locate the prior call where the representative explained how much money the customer could get back on their Part B premium.
Find the insurance outbound call in which the agent talked through copays for doctor visits and hospital stays.
Retrieve the conversation where the caller asked the client whether they had received their new Medicare card.
Search previous outbound calls for the transcript where the agent scheduled a follow-up appointment to enroll the client in a new plan.
Locate the earlier insurance outbound call where the representative confirmed that there would be no cost to review the client's benefits.
Find the conversation where the outreach specialist talked with a retiree about switching to a different health plan that might include dental checkups.
Search previous calls for the one where a senior was asked whether they were paying more than they needed each month for their government health coverage.
Locate the transcript in which the caller reviewed extra perks like help with eye glasses and hearing aids at no additional charge.
Retrieve the prior call where the agent mentioned the possibility of getting some money back from the program that deducts from the client's pension each month.
Search past outbound conversations for the one where the representative confirmed the color of the client's federal health card before comparing options.
Find the earlier call in which someone asked the client about the medications they take so they could check if a different plan might lower pharmacy costs.
Locate the transcript where the caller talked about lowering visit fees when seeing a family doctor or going to the hospital.
Retrieve the conversation where the agent set up a later appointment to go over new benefit options available in the client's postal code.
Search prior calls for the one where the outreach worker clarified that the review of the client's senior health benefits would not change anything without their consent.
Find the earlier outbound conversation where the representative asked whether the client had both the red-white-and-blue card and any additional coverage through a private company.
